head.title: ICI Plant to Make Safer Refrigerant

hedline.hl1: ICI Plant to Make Safer Refrigerant

block.p: LEAD: ICI Americas Inc., a subsidiary of the British chemical giant Imperial Chemical Industries P.L.C., said it would build a plant in Louisiana to make an environmentally safer alternative to ozone-depleting chloroflourocarbons. Chloroflourocarbons are used as the cooling agent in refrigerators and air-conditioners and in producing plastic foams and pharmaceuticals.

ICI Americas Inc., a subsidiary of the British chemical giant Imperial Chemical Industries P.L.C., said it would build a plant in Louisiana to make an environmentally safer alternative to ozone-depleting chloroflourocarbons. Chloroflourocarbons are used as the cooling agent in refrigerators and air-conditioners and in producing plastic foams and pharmaceuticals. Scientists say that the chlorine in CFC's destroys the upper atmosphere's ozone layer and leads to an increase in dangerous ultraviolet radiation reaching the earth.

The plant, in St. Gabriel, La., is expected to begin operation by early 1993 to produce the chemical, called KLEA 134a. Although the ICI product is also a flourocarbon, it is made without chlorine. A smaller production plant for the chemical is already under construction in England, ICI officials said.
